FeedItems.Title: View dependent packages on NuGet.org
FeedItems.Summary:
There are several ways to evaluate packages on NuGet.org, such as download statistics, update frequency, owner reputation, GitHub Usage, and more.
Today, we’re excited to announce that you can...

FeedItems.Title: Advanced search on NuGet.org
FeedItems.Summary: We are excited to announce that NuGet.org now supports one of our top customer asks – advanced search! You can now use a multitude of sorting and filtering criteria to help find the best NuGet...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet.org will permanently remove support for TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on June 15th
FeedItems.Summary: Last November, we shared our two-stage plan for deprecating TLS 1.0/1.1 on NuGet.org in which we stated that the permanent removal of TLS 1.0/1.1 support would occur in April 2020. However, in April,...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet.org will continue to support TLS 1.0 and 1.1 until further notice
FeedItems.Summary: Last November, we shared our two-stage plan for deprecating TLS 1.0/1.1 on NuGet.org and actions you can take today to ensure your systems use TLS 1.2. In that post, we announced that NuGet.org would...

FeedItems.Title: Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org ‚Äì Stage 1
FeedItems.Summary: Last November, we shared our two-stage plan for deprecating TLS 1.0/1.1 on NuGet.org and actions you can take today to ensure your systems use TLS 1.2. In this post, we will go into more details and a...

FeedItems.Title: Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org
FeedItems.Summary:
co-authored by Scott Bommarito
At Microsoft, using the latest and secure encryption techniques is very important to us to ensure the security and privacy of our customers. TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1,...

FeedItems.Title: Deprecating packages on nuget.org
FeedItems.Summary: We are excited to announce that nuget.org now supports package deprecation. This has been a long standing ask that will help the ecosystem use supported packages. As a package publisher on nuget.org,...

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Nuget installed " (#8170) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Nuget is installed, just not for me... üò£

ugh, i know... so instead of trying to cunstruct an application (that's how i got into this mess) i'm receptive to asking for help. there's quite a few `F ups but right now i need to remotely access my laptop in order to fix. Please, be kind to my mess. It's mine and i own that mess. i need help cleaning up the mess i have made out of my life.

G

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Test packages are visible on search results when filtering by last uploaded" (#8172) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
See twitter thread: https://twitter.com/buhakmeh/status/1299115494973341696

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Run Functional tests / E2E tests
2. Sort search results by "Recently updated"

### Expected behavior
User packages only are shown

### Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16807822/91502274-839e4d80-e87c-11ea-9953-8a7d873d0a2f.png)

### Additional context
We need to unlist/delete those packages after test completion

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Cookie Compliance] Finish the implementation on the front-end side." (#8171) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "[Cookie Compliance] Finish the implementation on the front-end side." (#8171) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "Store embedded readme file to storage" (#8166) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Summary of the changes:

* Store embedded readme into readmes container

No change in terms of displaying view model, use the current implementation to display 

Display embedded readme on details page
![display](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64443925/90726901-50a1fb80-e277-11ea-93bf-a9fbbe64a665.PNG)


Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3266

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Nuget.Frameworks 5.8 prev2 is missing" (#9947) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm not clear about what's going on, but I think there should be Nuget.Frameworks 5.8 prev2 at https://www.nuget.org/packages/NuGet.Frameworks/

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5352980/91295377-3bb1f480-e7b0-11ea-9625-2c252cad7b35.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Improve testing facilities for mono" (#6784) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Keep Mono in mind when writing tests, which DLL they go to. 

Add Mono tests on Linux and Windows 

Document what tests run where

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Investigate the assets file comparison further and add more extensive lock file comparison tests" (#6488) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Issue became apparent in this PR. 
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/1979
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/2052

We need to add tests for the above PR and make sure there aren't any other low hanging fruits there.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Show more information for a dependency's browse object in the dependencies tree" (#9616) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
From https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3392/files/a462d871eebed985c3a3fe7fd145d75f7d30267e#r430953620

We could show more information in the browse object of transitive dependencies. For example, Include/Exclude values.

Someone with a deeper understanding of the domain should review this and see what's missing.

The NuGet side of this would apply only to transitive references. The .NET Project System would control the equivalent information for top-level references.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Error NU5008: Manifest file not found at path" (#9418) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "'nuget restore' via CLI does not restore content files" (#9392) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## nuget restore does not restore content files

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): nuget.exe

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 5.4.0

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Win Server 2019

**This bug ruins CI/CD** because my web project's `/Scripts` folder and similar JavaScript/CSS/images and other static stuff is not being copied during deploy!

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Issue with load list of package versions (nuget list [search terms] [options])" (#9378) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When I call:
`nuget list [search terms] [options]`
for example:
`nuget list Xamarin.Android.Arch.Core.Common`
I expect, as descripted in documentation, that this command will return a list of versions for current package. But instead of this, the command is loaded all packages with latest versions. It takes a lot of time.
As I remember, previous version was loaded only list of versions available for current package

NuGet Version: 5.5.0.6382
OS: MacOS

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet pack ignoring AssemblyInformationalVersion for netcoreapp3.1 targetframework library" (#9296) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Remove the content above here and fill out details below.

## Details about Problem
Creating a NuGet package targeting  netcoreapp3.1 (to share some extensions for startup for aspnetcore) the nuget packaging is ignoring the versioning used in the project and default to 1.0.0.0 (and also complains about description and other properties not being set even though they are in the project file).

If I take the same project and target netstandard2.0 it properly uses my in-code defined AssemblyInformationalVersion

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):
NuGet.exe
NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):
5.4.0.6315

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Grab a simple repo project attached here
[NugetVersioningIssue.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/4328470/NugetVersioningIssue.zip)


2. Build project and note that the version # for all the files correctly uses the PipelineAssemblyVersionInfo.cs values for the versioning of the built files.

3. Pack them into nuget package:
nuget pack NugetVersioningIssue.csproj -OutputDirectory pack -Properties Configuration=Release -IncludeReferencedProjects

...

## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...)
NuGet Version: 5.4.0.6315
Attempting to build package from 'NugetVersioningIssue.csproj'.
MSBuild auto-detection: using msbuild version '16.6.0.15301' from 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Preview\MSBuild\Current\Bin'. Use option -MSBuildVersion to force nuget to use a specific version of MSBuild.
Packing files from 'C:\Users\gboland\source\repos\NugetVersioningIssue\bin\Release\netcoreapp3.1'.
Could not load file or assembly 'System.Runtime, Version=4.2.2.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified.
Add file 'C:\Users\gboland\source\repos\NugetVersioningIssue\bin\Release\netcoreapp3.1\NugetVersioningIssue.dll' to package as 'lib\netcoreapp3.1\NugetVersioningIssue.dll'
WARNING: NU5115: Description was not specified. Using 'Description'.
WARNING: NU5115: Author was not specified. Using 'gboland'.

Id: NugetVersioningIssue
Version: 1.0.0
Authors: gboland
Description: Description
Dependencies:

Added file '[Content_Types].xml'.
Added file '_rels/.rels'.
Added file 'lib/netcoreapp3.1/NugetVersioningIssue.dll'.
Added file 'NugetVersioningIssue.nuspec'.
Added file 'package/services/metadata/core-properties/f42f1531000b472596732ad9aabc5f51.psmdcp'.

Successfully created package 'D:\Sources\SmartML\pack\NugetVersioningIssue.1.0.0.nupkg'.
WARNING: NU5128: Some target frameworks declared in the dependencies group of the nuspec and the lib/ref folder do not have exact matches in the other location. Consult the list of actions below:
- Add a dependency group for .NETCoreApp3.1 to the nuspec

### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The "ResolvePackageDependencies" task failed unexpectedly - An item with the same key has already been added" (#9818) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Error	MSB4018	The "ResolvePackageDependencies" task failed unexpectedly.
System.ArgumentException: An item with the same key has already been added.
   at System.ThrowHelper.ThrowArgumentException(ExceptionResource resource)
   at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.Insert(TKey key, TValue value, Boolean add)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToDictionary[TSource,TKey,TElement](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`2 keySelector, Func`2 elementSelector, IEqualityComparer`1 comparer)
   at Microsoft.NET.Build.Tasks.ResolvePackageDependencies.GetPackageAndFileDependencies(LockFileTarget target)
   at Microsoft.NET.Build.Tasks.ResolvePackageDependencies.RaiseLockFileTargets()
   at Microsoft.NET.Build.Tasks.ResolvePackageDependencies.ExecuteCore()
   at Microsoft.NET.Build.Tasks.TaskBase.Execute()
   at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskExecutionHost.Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.ITaskExecutionHost.Execute()
   at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskBuilder.<ExecuteInstantiatedTask>d__26.MoveNext()	
## Details about Problem

VS UI

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. I have a complex Solution. This error I get after some Nuget Updates during build.

2. How can I find out wich Nuget is causing the issue and why?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Contentfile in nuget gets compiled causing build errors" (#9123) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I have a nuget that has a contentfile in it. ContentFile is a json file and denoted as such in the nuspec file when the nuget is packed.

When installing the nuget in a regular wpf app, I get a couple build errors. It appears that Visual Studio is trying to compile the .json file. Wondering if anyone knows what may cause this??? As you'll see in the nuspec snippet I have BuildAction=None in the nuspec

ContentFile.json(1,1,1,2): error CS1022: Type or namespace definition, or end-of-file expected
ContentFile.json(4,16,4,26): error CS1001: Identifier expected
ContentFile.json(4,37,4,45): error CS1001: Identifier expected

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19433674/73555610-f1d07e00-441b-11ea-81be-05b14b2ab0f2.png)


Note: Visual Studio 19. The nuget was packed from command line using nuget.exe in a batch script. The batch script runs "nuget.exe update --self" before packing the nuget

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "From Azure Pipeline restore package succeed, but the content (css,js ,img) of package is not added in Web application .net" (#9073) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Remove the content above here and fill out details below.

## Details about Problem
From Azure Pipeline restore package succeed, but the content (css,js ,img) of package is not added in Web application .net
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19317872/72763207-a4991480-3bb0-11ea-8be7-bde3405df93c.png)


NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

NuGet version :4.4.1

VS 2019

 Agent.OS Version | 10.0.17763 Microsoft Windows Server 2019 Standard (self Hosted Agent Azure Pipelines)

Agent.Version | 2.144.2

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1.Execute Azure pipeline 
2. Restore Nuget package 
3. Build Solution: Faild, because it can't copy content (css,js,jpg,png) of package installed  in project web app C# VS 2019

## Other suggested things
in the Visual Studio Install package, but content don't copy in project. i must execute command Update-Package -reinstall in package manager console.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Annotate assembly references from NuGet packages with ResolveFrom metadata" (#3468) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
`@(ReferencePath)` from regular assembly references contain metadata like `ResolvedFrom={TargetFrameworkDirectory}` or `ResolvedFrom=ImplicitlyExpandDesignTimeFacades`. It would be nice if the references added by [ResolveNuGetPackageAssets](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.BuildTasks/blob/dev/src/Microsoft.NuGet.Build.Tasks/ResolveNuGetPackageAssets.cs#L311) annotated the reference as resolved by NuGet (maybe `ResolvedFrom=Package`?).

Currently, because this metadata isn't provided, they end up having `ResolvedFrom={RawFileName}`. 

This would allow other tooling/targets to tell apart these references from others. (yes, I know the presence of the `NuGetPackageId` metadata can be used for the same, but for consistency with the way references are managed elsewhere, it would still be useful).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unable to locate the 'nuget' [b3be7473-68ea-4a81-bfc7-9530baaa19ad] area" (#7183) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Our VSTS build was successfully executing and nothing changed in the code, but suddenly, build started failing with following error saying 'Nuget' is not available in you area. Not sure what it means and how to resolve it.

The spec for 'Advanced Search on NuGet.org' is ready for **review**:

| Spec wiki | Discussion issue |
| :----------:| :----------------: |
| [Advanced Search on NuGet.org](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/wiki/Advanced-Search-on-NuGet.org) | [NuGet/NuGetGallery#2636](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/2636) |

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CVE-2020-1340 - NuGet Gallery Spoofing Vulnerability" (#45) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
A spoofing vulnerability exists when the NuGet Gallery does not properly sanitize input on package metadata values. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could perform cross-site scripting attacks and run scripts in the security context of the user viewing the malicious content.

To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker with permissions to upload packages could publish specially crafted content on a gallery page.

The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how NuGet Gallery sanitizes input.

**MSRC Security Guidance:** [CVE-2020-1340](https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1340)
**Security Update:** [v2020.06.09](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/releases/tag/v2020.06.09)
